bookPages: The lone hooded man slowly walked across the desert plains, the setting sun casting an orange light on the golden-yellow sand. Few things stood on the dunes, the odd cactus, a few tufts of dead grass, the occasional skeletal remains of a poor soul who did

not manage to find water in time, or had their mortal tether suddenly cut short by something more sinister...
The setting orb of the sun finally settled under the silent waves of sand, a few odd noises the only sign of life other than this old hooded man.

He looked on, trudging along the sand dunes, and suddenly tripped. 
"What on...?"
A hand.

He looked at it, quizzically, and it twitched. He took a step back from it, horror in his eyes as the hand rose, then an arm, then...
Undead.

As he spun about, more of the lurching figures were slowly but surely surrounding him. He backed away in one direction, only to be swiped at, stepped back a few paces and got grabbed. He closed his eyes, waiting for death, mouthing a silent prayer to

Methabeht. 
And then...
Nothing happened.
He opened his eyes, and looked about. Somehow, all these dark mannequins were no longer animate, lying on the bare desert ground. He looked at the lone surviver, as a silent strike of lightning hit it,

splitting it in half. The old man fell to his knees, tears in his eyes. 
"Thank you my lord, oh thank you..."
And the sun rose again on the lone man.
